mdRecord.dcterms:title: Deposition of George Fayette Washington,1820 May 2
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, George Fayette, 1790-1867
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Deposition of George Fayette Washington before William Waters, justice of the peace in Washington, D.C. -- deposer is the only surviving son of George A. Washington, late a Lieutenant in Virginia continental line -- claim for U.S. bounty lands -- his brother Charles A. and sister Anna Maria Thornton are dead, & sister's sons Charles A. & Churchill J. Thornton to receive half. Document signed, 1 page, docketed "Memo. May 2d to ex. and Rept. tomorrow." watermark (D. Ames).
